intro: Hieracium petiolare, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are heart-shaped or oval. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium petiolare is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
